candidates.title: Move testkit-server into a separate crate
Prepare examples for publishing
candidates.body: Testkit depends on `cryptocurrency`, so it must be published too.

candidates.title: Update minor dependencies version.
candidates.body:
<!--
****Please describe the pull request motivation and changes here
along with non-obvious things.
-->

candidates.title: Use fixed (with `=` prefix) versions for unstable (before 1.0) dependencies
candidates.body: Dependencies that didn't reach `1.0` version can (more often) bring breaking changes in patch releases. Fixed versions are used to prevent situations with unexpected (and uncontrollable) breakage.

candidates.title: Transfer benches to criterion-rs
candidates.body: Using criterion-rs allows us to bench on stable rust, and collect better statistic proven data.

candidates.title: Support Decimals
candidates.body: The Decimal datatype is crucial for financial applications hence we have to support it.

candidates.title: Add VoteAgainst to configuration service
candidates.body:
MaybeVote is converted to generic struct. The rest of implementation is straight forward.

closes #634

candidates.title: Move timestemping into the core repository

labels.name: discussion :speech_balloon:
labels.description: The design isn't finalized yet, feel free to participate in the discussion.

candidates.title: Logging middleware for testkit
candidates.body: As a part of bringing #459 to shape, this PR introduces logging middleware for the testkit API and adds corresponding tests.

candidates.title: Property testing for `ProofMapIndex`
candidates.body: This PR includes [property testing](https://crates.io/crates/proptest) for proofs generated by `ProofMapIndex`.

candidates.title: Refactor testkit get_err method to return ApiError [ECR-990]
candidates.body:
Testkit users may want to test against response status codes. In order to make it implementation agnostic, I decided to use `ApiError` as return value for `get_err` method.

Also one more dev dependency for `testkit` has been introduced: https://github.com/SimonSapin/rust-std-candidates/tree/master/matches

It helps a lot with checking destructured `ApiError`s without pattern matching boilerplate.

TODO: write more unit tests for covering `Into<TestkitApiError> for Response` implementation.
